alert.note: Alert for Bee; Jim Wells; Live Oak (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 09 at 3:09AM CDT until August 09 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ACROSS THE BRUSH COUNTRY AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... .The combination of strong southerly winds at around 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 30 mph, relative humidity values as low as 20 percent and dry to critically dry soils will be conducive for critical fire weather conditions across the Brush Country and Rio Grande Plains Wednesday afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE EASTERN BRUSH COUNTRY... The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has issued a Red Flag Warning for the eastern Brush Country, which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Live Oak, Bee and Jim Wells. * TIMING...From 1 PM to 7 PM Wednesday. * WINDS...South 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 108. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Residents are urged to exercise care with respect to all outdoor activities that could inadvertently cause wildfires. Report wildfires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
